text: Fragum nivale is a species of cockle in the family Cardiidae, that lives in the Western Indian Ocean, in benthic environments. It has a body length of 1.2 cm, and the embryos are developed into a swimming trocophore larvae, that resemble an immature clam. ==References== Category:Bivalves described in 1845 Category:Cardiidae Category:Molluscs of the Indian Ocean
title: Fragum nivale
